meanings.definition: The ability to catch fire easily.
meanings.sent1: The flammability of the dry leaves made them a fire hazard.
meanings.sent2: Firefighters are trained to assess the flammability of different materials.
meanings.sent3: The campers joked about the flammability of their marshmallows as they roasted them over the fire.
meanings.sent4: The flammability of the situation was evident as tensions rose between the two rival groups.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a demonstration to show the students the flammability of certain chemicals.

meanings.definition: The state of being easily set on fire.
meanings.sent1: The forest's flammability was a concern during the dry season.
meanings.sent2: The old barn's flammability posed a risk to the surrounding buildings.
meanings.sent3: The flammability of the scarecrow's straw hat added a humorous touch to the farm scene.
meanings.sent4: The flammability of the political climate was compared to a tinderbox waiting to ignite.
meanings.sent5: The safety inspector noted the flammability of the curtains in the theater.
